bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
I tried to compile MXNet using the cmake command: <denchmark-code>cmake -GNinja -C ../config.cmake .. cmake --build . </denchmark-code>
and then install horovod <denchmark-code>HOROVOD_WITHOUT_TENSORFLOW=1 HOROVOD_GPU_ALLREDUCE=NCCL HOROVOD_GPU_BROADCAST=NCCL pip3 install -e . --no-cache-dir --user </denchmark-code>
The error message is <denchmark-code>/home/ubuntu/mxnet/python/mxnet/../../include/mkldnn/dnnl.hpp:23:10: fatal error: dnnl_config.h: No such file or directory </denchmark-code>
I find that we have these lines in mkldnn.mk
incubator-mxnet/mkldnn.mk
Lines 52 to 53 in c2aff58
cp $(MKLDNN_BUILDDIR)/include/dnnl_version.h $(MXNET_INCLDIR)/mkldnn/.
cp $(MKLDNN_BUILDDIR)/include/dnnl_config.h $(MXNET_INCLDIR)/mkldnn/.
The problem might be that we haven't copied the files to mxnet/include/mkldnn so the build system used in horovod is broken.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/leezu>@leezu</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apeforest>@apeforest</denchmark-link> Have you met problems when building horovod with cmake-built MXNet?

A temporary fix is to manually copy files inside the build directory to include/mkldnn. I've confirmed that this solves the problem in horovod installation. <denchmark-code>cp build/3rdparty/mkldnn/include/dnnl_config.h include/mkldnn cp build/3rdparty/mkldnn/include/dnnl_version.h include/mkldnn </denchmark-code>

I will take a look at this. I remember previously the recommended build system of mxnet was makefile when cooperating with horovod. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sxjscience>@sxjscience</denchmark-link> is this the only issue when using cmake to build mxnet and linking it to horovod?

That’s currently the only one I found for linking to horovod. However I just ran setup.py in horovod and hasn’t run distributed training yet. I’m having some other issues in the cmake-built MXNet which I’m still investigating.
